links.title: Apple Car | Release Dates, Features, Specs, Rumors
links.description: Perhaps Apple's worst kept secret, the "Apple Car" is being developed for a 2024 or later release. Rumors speculate that it will be a fully-featured self-driving electric vehicle that will compete with Tesla and other EVs. Apple could partner with other popular manufacturers like Hyundai or BMW, or seek another option.

body: $AAPL  Channel up in a bear flag with the McClellan rising & RSI falling with the ADX topping. You want to sell the ADX at the top & buy at the bottom. It is also beginning an abc Elliott wave pattern & is at the beginning of a long down "a"wave. BB's are converging but the alligator is rolling over creating a bearish pattern & the 4dma is about to breach the 9, another bearish confirmation. There is also a sell signal on the TDSequential demark indicator. If 157 doesn't hold then it goes to 145.

body: $MVIS $AAPL
$AAPL      🍏👍

$AMZN $AAPL $GOOG $FB $MSFT 

Right now I’m personally playing cautious but that doesn’t mean I won't start playing aggressively again sometime in the future. I'm a patient investor and I always wait for opportunities to come to me. I just follow my strategy that led me to outperform the market by 3x to 10x every single year for the past 7 years. And I’m confident to say that 2022 will be no different.

$AMZN $AAPL $GOOG $FB $MSFT 

Since everything except a few dominating companies did well in the 2nd half of 2021, that might intrigue the average retail investor to say: “You know what, fuck it. The market gave massive returns this year while my portfolio completely sucked, why would I continue sucking at picking individual stocks when I can just ride the S&P 500 and make great returns? ”.. And then guess what happens? They all end up buying the broader indexes and that’s finally when we get a decent pullback. That might be what ends up happening and it’s something to keep in mind. Market makers know exactly how to play with investors’ emotions.

$AMZN $AAPL $GOOG $FB $MSFT 

There are times when you need to press on the accelerator and invest aggressively and that’s exactly what I did for 2020 and early 2021 which gave me amazing returns (750%+ in less than a year – from March 2020 to Feb 2021). Then I began playing a bit more conservatively and rotated away of riskier assets between February and April of 2021. That's exactly when frothy pockets & sectors of the market began selling off. Look at ARKK, look at small caps, look at some of the cryptocurrencies, look at the performance of emerging markets, they all peaked around that time and never recovered since. If I didn’t slam on the brakes and started playing more conservatively, my portfolio would’ve finished with a very weak return, but I still managed to beat the market by more than 4x in 2021 which I’m very happy about.

$AMZN $AAPL $GOOG $FB $MSFT 

You also have people quitting their jobs to invest in crypto, you have people who are buying digital ape images for several millions of dollars, you have people buying “digital real estate” in the metaverse for millions of dollars.. if there was ever a euphoric market environment, this is it. I think people are too invested in the idea of decentralized currencies and many of them fail to see the potential dangers of it. I’ve said it many times before, the cryptocurrency craze will likely cause one of the next financial crises but it’s impossible to time it and you don’t protect your portfolio by shorting an index that carries the 5 dominating companies in America which are still fairly valued as we speak.

$AMZN $AAPL $MSFT $GOOG $FB 

This is why higher valuations don’t mean anything anymore. These companies are increasing their sales & revenues 10x faster than the top companies back in the 1900’s. These are not your typical Coca Cola companies here. So anyone who thinks shorting SPY or QQQ is a good idea, they truly deserve to fail. But would it be wise to be a bit more cautious during this time? Yes, I’d say so. Firstly, the S&P 500 yielded a total return of 90% in the past 3 years alone which is very unusual. We have extremely high inflation, and we know that this surge in demand for products and services is only temporary. That means future earnings growth will eventually go back to regular levels and that might shock algos/machines who keep buying some of these companies as though this kind of growth will continue forever.

Market outlook for 2022: 

As always, I’m bullish. You can’t ever be bearish when the world is still growing. Population is still rising, innovation is taking place and people are spending more hours than ever on the internet. The US is the leading country in the internet-tech sector. Just look at the 5 biggest companies in America: $AAPL, $MSFT, $FB, $AMZN & $GOOG (I’m not going to include TSLA in there because it’s a temporary craze that will subside with time). We have a company that produces the best smartphones in the world, a company that produces the best desktop software in the world (80%+ of all computers in the world use Microsoft software), a company with the most popular social media platforms (Facebook & Instagram) and makes advertisement revenue like we’ve never seen before, an online shopping company that saves you time and money instead of going to physical stores & a company with the most dominant search engine & video sharing platform on the internet.
$AAPL calls anybody?
$AAPL Tesla, you beauty🚀🚀
